medical_history.chief_complaint: Discovery of a right upper lobe mass during a total body CT scan.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began following a total body computed tomography (CT) as part of an initial annual executive medical assessment, which revealed the mass. The condition progressed to a diagnosis of adenocarcinoma after a CT-guided biopsy. There were no reported cardiopulmonary symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Germline TP53 mutation confirmed through genetic testing; no additional past medical conditions specified.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of multiple cancers: mother diagnosed with stage 1B RUL NSCLC with an EGFR mutation at age 69, twin sister had invasive moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma of the sigmoid colon at age 31, maternal aunt with breast cancer at age 65, and first cousin diagnosed with prostate cancer at age 55.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has no smoking history and no concerning environmental exposures.
